evidence.text: In September 2018, a three-judge panel issued Martin v. City of Boise, 902 F.3d 1031 (9th Cir. 2018), holding "the Eighth Amendment prohibits the imposition of criminal penalties for sitting, sleeping, or lying outside on public property for homeless individuals who cannot obtain shelter."

extracted.value: Martin v. City of Boise, 902 F.3d 1031 (9th Cir. 2018)

evidence.text: In Robinson, the Supreme Court struck down, under the Eighth Amendment, a California law that made "it a criminal offense for a person to 'be addicted to the use of narcotics.'"

extracted.value: Robinson v. California, 370 U.S. 660 (1962)

evidence.text: In Powell, a fractured Supreme Court rejected Powell's challenge to his conviction, under a Texas statute, for being "found in a state of intoxication in any public place."

extracted.value: Powell v. Texas, 392 U.S. 514 (1968)

evidence.text: JOHNSON V. CITY OF GRANTS PASS

extracted.value: Appeal: Johnson, Logan, and other plaintiffs appealed to Ninth Circuit
